field.name: summary
field.value: Startable components need their dependencies registered before them in the configuration file

field.name: description
field.value: If a startable component has its dependencies registered after itself in the Windsor configuration file a DependencyResolverException exception is raised, saying that its dependencies cannot be resolved. I think this should instead be placed in the queue of components waiting for its dependencies to be resolved, then, when they are, then the component might be immediately instantiated and eventually started calling the Start method. Obviously, if the dependencies are registered before the component itself then it all works as expected.
